page.title: 01Rural Village on Roman Road
page.content: Clayworth street unchanged for 1000 years. Landscape now predoninantly arable, 8 tiny deciduous woods, 5 newly planted. Nine farms replace 25 smallholdings. Two dairy and 1 herd. Cropping mainly cereals, oil-seed rape, formerly 'Clayworth Pink' celery. Few acres meadowland remain. Six miles public footpaths provide glimpse of wild flowers. Population 300. Twenty private new dwellings in 15 years. Four bungalows and 13 houses built by the council over 30 years. School and shop closed. Young population on the increase. Post Office retained, alternative premises. Major church restoration, new village hall. Community activities include revival of Plough Monday play. Many professional 2 car families. Some employment provided by the hotel, 2 restaurants, farms.
